results.title: Culloden [B&W] (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Watkins and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the Battle of Culloden, fought in 1746 between the Scottish Jacobites and an English force led by the Duke of Cumberland. In this film, the director utilises a television reportage style to recreate and analyse the battle.

results.title: Cullens Lake
results.creator_credit: David Corke and Victorian Field and Game Association
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Wetlands of Victoria”.
Cullens Lake is near Kerang in Victoria and provides an ideal habitat for many different varieties of water birds. It also provides a drought relief area for water birds that are forced to leave their usual habitat of inland rivers. This film looks at the lake and the birds that use it. Examines the threat to the lake by plans of the State Rivers and Water Commission of Victoria to turn it into a salinity basin. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part series. Demonstrates in detail the testing of wool samples using portable Sonic Fineness Tester Model B.

results.title: CSIRO Sonic fineness testers. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Demonstrates two methods of measuring fineness, or the diameter of the fibre, in wool: in the laboratory using Sonic Fineness Tester Model A, and in the field using portable Sonic Fineness Tester Model B.

results.title: Crystals and their growth
results.brief_description: Crystals of quartz, granite, snow and salt are used to show the nature and growth of crystals and their importance in modern science and technology. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crystal diode (Episode 4)
results.brief_description: Looks at the effect of a voltage in the barrier region, rectification of current by a crystal diode; the diode characteristic; and rectification of a sine wave. From the “Semiconductor Physics” series, part 4.

results.title: Cry wolf
results.creator_credit: John Davis, Michael Truman, Children's Film Foundation and Damor Leaderfilm
results.brief_description: A young boy, Tony Walker (Anthony Kemp) has a habit of calling the police for crimes that don’t exist. Tony discovers that two men are planning to kidnap the Prime Minister - needless to say, no-one believes him. Finally Tony and his group of friends foil the efforts of the would-be kidnappers. Cast includes Ian Hendry, Wilfred Bramble, Maurice Kaufmann, Eileen Moore and Alfred Bell.

results.title: Cry for help
results.creator_credit: A. Scott Miller and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A young boy falls into his family’s swimming pool. When he is discovered the emergency service is called and saves the boy with the help of a local hospital. Then the narration describes the essential elements of a successful community emergency service including a common emergency phone number, well equipped ambulances and communication between ambulances and hospitals.

results.title: Cry
results.creator_credit: Nicola Loder, Peter Tammer and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: A woman returns to the remnants of life she abandoned years earlier. A dark, mysterious and redemptive story exploring the interplay between truth and memory.
